xxl.core.io.converters

Class ShortArrayConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.io.converters.Converter<short[]>
      • xxl.core.io.converters.ShortArrayConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ShortArrayConverter
extends Converter<short[]>
    This class provides a converter that is able to read and write arrays of short values. First the converter reads or writes the length of the short array. Thereafter the short values are read or written.

    Example usage (1). 

       // create a short array
   
   short[] array = {1024, 255, 1923, 0};
   
   // create a byte array output stream
   
   ByteArrayOutputStream output = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
   
   // write array to the output stream
   
   ShortArrayConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.write(new DataOutputStream(output), array);
   
   // create a byte array input stream on the output stream
   
   ByteArrayInputStream input = new ByteArrayInputStream(output.toByteArray());
   
   // reset the array
   
   array = null;
   
   // read array from the input stream
   
   array = ShortArrayConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.read(new DataInputStream(input));
   
   // print the array
   
   for (short s : array)
       System.out.println(s);
       
   // close the streams after use
   
   input.close();
   output.close();

    See Also:
    DataInput, DataOutput, IOException, Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_INSTANCE

        public static final ShortArrayConverter DEFAULT_INSTANCE
        This instance can be used for getting a default instance of a short array converter. It is similar to the Singleton Design Pattern (for further details see Creational Patterns, Prototype in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides) except that there are no mechanisms to avoid the creation of other instances of a short array converter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShortArrayConverter

        public ShortArrayConverter()

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public short[] read(DataInput dataInput,
                    short[] object)
             throws IOException
        Reads an array of short values from the specified data input and returns the restored short array.

        When the specified short array is null this implementation returns a new array of short values, otherwise the size of the specified short array has to be sufficient.

        Specified by:
        read in class Converter<short[]>
        Parameters:
        dataInput - the stream to read the short array from.
        object - the short array to be restored.
        Returns:
        the read array of short values.
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O errors occur.

      • write

        public void write(DataOutput dataOutput,
                  short[] object)
           throws IOException
        Writes the specified array of short values to the specified data output.

        This implementation first writes the length of the array to the data output. Thereafter the short values are written.

        Specified by:
        write in class Converter<short[]>
        Parameters:
        dataOutput - the stream to write the short array to.
        object - the short array that should be written to the data output.
        Throws:
        IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

      • getSerializedSize

        public int getSerializedSize(short[] object)
        Determines the size of the short array in bytes.
        Parameters:
        object - the short array.
        Returns:
        the size of the short array in bytes.
        See Also:
        SizeConverter.getSerializedSize(java.lang.Object)
